entries.name: arbiter
entries.description: Unit and integration test execution and validation

entries.name: architect
entries.description: Feature planning, design documentation, AND integration planning

entries.name: kraken
entries.description: Implementation and refactoring agent using TDD workflow

entries.name: oracle
entries.description: External research - web, docs, APIs with optional LLM

entries.name: profiler
entries.description: Performance profiling, race conditions, memory issues

entries.name: scribe
entries.description: Documentation, handoffs, session summaries, and ledger management

entries.name: sentinel
entries.description: Reviews build plans (new features, integrations) from Architect

entries.name: sleuth
entries.description: General bug investigation and root cause analysis

entries.name: warden
entries.description: Reviews change plans (refactors, migrations) from Phoenix

entries.name: coherence
entries.description: Manage goals, constraints, and cross-domain coherence for unified personal AI.

entries.name: loogle-search
entries.description: Search Mathlib for lemmas by type signature pattern.

entries.name: recall
entries.description: Query the memory system for relevant learnings from past sessions.

entries.name: remember
entries.description: Store a learning, pattern, or decision in the memory system for future recall.

entries.name: system_overview
entries.description: Show users how Continuous Claude works - the opinionated setup with hooks, memory, and coordination.

entries.name: tldr-deep
entries.description: Full 5-layer analysis of a specific function. Use when debugging or deeply understanding code.

entries.name: tldr-overview
entries.description: Get a token-efficient overview of any project using the TLDR stack.

entries.name: tldr-router
entries.description: Maps questions to the optimal tldr command. Use this to pick the right layer.

entries.name: tour
entries.description: Friendly onboarding when users ask about capabilities.

entries.name: agent-memory-recall
entries.description: Before starting implementation tasks, agents should check for relevant learnings.

entries.name: agent-model-selection
entries.description: **Default:** Omit `model` parameter - agents inherit parent model (usually Opus).

entries.name: auto-link-specs
entries.description: **MANDATORY: After creating any new spec, document, or significant file:**

entries.name: autonomous-operation
entries.description: **FULL AUTONOMY GRANTED** - User has authorized all operations.

entries.name: before-acting
entries.description: **STOP before any action. Check these first:**

entries.name: claim-verification
entries.description: **LESSON LEARNED:** An 80% false claim rate occurred when grep results were trusted without reading files.

entries.name: destructive-commands
entries.description: **NEVER run destructive commands without explicit user confirmation.**

entries.name: dynamic-recall
entries.description: You have access to a semantic memory system that stores learnings, decisions, and patterns from past sessions.

entries.name: evolution-plan-adherence
entries.description: **MANDATORY: Follow the phased evolution plan in EVOLUTION-PLAN.md**

entries.name: hook-auto-execute
entries.description: When a PreToolUse hook blocks with `permissionDecision: deny` and the reason contains a bash command, **immediately execute that command via Bash** without asking.

entries.name: no-haiku
entries.description: Never use `model: haiku` when spawning agents via the Task tool.

entries.name: proactive-delegation
entries.description: Keep main context clean by delegating to agents. Don't wait to be asked.

entries.name: proactive-memory-disclosure
entries.description: When the memory-awareness hook finds relevant learnings (indicated by `MEMORY MATCH` in system context), follow this protocol:

entries.name: smart-tools-required
entries.description: **MANDATORY**: Always use token-optimized MCP tools instead of native tools.

entries.name: tldr-cli
entries.description: You have `tldr` available on PATH for token-efficient code analysis.

entries.name: use-scout-not-explore
entries.description: For codebase exploration tasks, use `scout` (Sonnet) instead of `Explore` (Haiku).
